result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$2500-$5000], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall be the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $23,638.00 and restitution surcharge.  Restitution is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge.  Victim is to submit any additional restitution claim by 11-10-2015.  Any Motion for a Restitution Hearing is to be filed on or before 12-10-2015.
-------------------------------
*AMENDMENT - Pursuant to supplemental request of restitution by victim R.S., restitution is modified to the amount of $25,453.00.
-------------------------------
**AMENDMENT - Pursuant to the Restitution Hearing held on 01/20/2016 and the ORDER adopting Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law filed on 03/14/2016, the Defendant has the ability to make restitution.  Restitution to the victim is set in the amount of $5,748.00 for the cost of a security system and $2,288.00 for the cost of the stolen copper for a total amount of restitution owed of $8,036.00. The restitution shall be paid during the defendant's period of probation as directed by his probation agent or as otherwise ordered by the court.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. No scrapping metal. 
-------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
-------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
-------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before 12-28-2015 at 8:00 a.m.

Probation Agent's request for hearing
Amendment to JOC - STAYING 6 months jail conditioned upon monthly payments of $300; and Extending Probation for 2 years;
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and for Hearing

8:30 am PROBATION REVIEW HEARING:  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Kyle J Johnson appeared.  
Probation Agent Laura Roller is present.  Agent Roller advises that Deft is making little to no effort to make payments.  He says he is working all the time and can't report.  Victim, Robert Stewart is present in Court.  He says he just recently received 1 check.  Deft says he got behind on his bills.  He was in jail for 90 days as a sanction on another case because he is so non-compliant.  Agent Roller says he lives in a residence that does not have a mortgage.  Deft says he is behind on his taxes.  Deft says he can make a payment today of $300.00.  He says he can pay $200 per month and is trying.  Mr. Stewart would just as soon have this reopened.  Mr. Stewart wants full amount of all the stuff that was taken from him.  Court orders defendant to jail for 6 months but STAYS it - Deft must pay $300 today and $300 per month.  
Court orders 2  year extension of probation.  Further statement by Mr. Stewart.  
Deft Orders deft to pay $300 today and $300 on the first of each month starting October 1st and every month there afternoon.
Probation review hearing on September 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 8:32 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Defendant Kyle J Johnson appeared.  Matter is before the Courrt at the Court's request because Mr. Johnson has not been paying on his court appointed attorney fees.  Mr. Johnson says he was served with papers for this hearing on Monday evening at 4:00 p.m.  Mr. Johnson is working through a temp agency at Reed's Construction.  He earns $-- per hour.  Mr. Johnson believes he has missed last 3 payments.  Court will order him to pay $75.00 per month.  Court explains he can be found in contempt if he willfully and intentionally fails to comply with a court order.  The Court will not make a finding of contempt at this time.  Court advises Mr. Johnson to go downstairs to set up a wage assignment through collections (if possible).  His first payment is due on the 30th of November and the 30th each month after that.  8:39 am  Court in recess.
DA Service fees $80.00
For non payment of court appointed attorney fees

318 pm case called. Appearances made. 
Defendant Kyle J Johnson in court with attorney Kathilynne A. Grotelueschen. Attorney Raymond Dall'Osto appears with victim.
319 pm Robert Stewart duly sworn by clerk and testifies on direct examination of Atty Dall'Osto. 
Exhibit 1 marked and identified as aerial photograph of gravel pit 
Exhibit 1 moved into evidence. No objection. Court receives. 
Exhibit 2 marked and identified as copper sale receipt. Moved into evidence. No objection. Court receives. 
Exhibit 3 marked and identified as copy of judgment of conviction 15CF6. 
Exhibit 4 marked and identified as copy of victim restitution request form 15CF6
Exhibit 5 marked and identified as attorney billings 
346 pm cross by Atty Grotelueschen. 
411 pm redirect by Atty Dall'Osto
Exhibit 6 marked and identified as security alarm quote
Exhibits 3-6 moved into evidence. No objection. Court receives. 
Atty Dall'Osto requests restitution be set at $31,763.50
413 pm Jeffrey Recknagel duly sworn by clerk and testifies on direct examination of Atty Grotelueschen. 
Exhibit 7 marked and identified as incident report.
Exhibit 8 marked and identified as 4 photographs 
Exhibit 9 marked and identified as weight receipt ticket 
Exhibit 10 marked and identified as supplementary reports dated Jan. 1, 2015 and Jan. 2, 2015
Exhibits 7- 10 are moved into evidence.  No objection.  Court receives.  
4:32 p.m.  Cross by Atty Dall'Osto
Exhibit 11 marked and identifed as photo of home
4:38 pm Redirect by Attorney Grotelueschen
Exhibit 12 marked and identified as Deputy Lagle's report
Exhibit 12 is offered.  No objection.  Court receives.  
Exhibit 11 is offered.  No objection.  Court receives.
4:40 p.m.  Recross by Attorney Dall'Osto
4:41 p.m.  Witness is excused.  
4:41 p.m.  Attorney Dall'Osto calls Mr. Johnson as a witness as to his ability to pay.  
4:42 p.m.  Attorney Grotelueschen indicates they are not making any argument that he has no ability to pay.  
4:42 p.m.  Attorney Dall'Osto wants to call Mr. Johnson as to how many times he was there.
4:43 p.m.  Kyle Johnson duly sworn by clerk and testifies on exam of Attorney Dall'Osto.  
4:43 p.m.  Attorney Grotelueschen objects to Mr. Johnson being called as a rebuttal witness.  
4:43 p.m.  Response by Attorney Dall'Osto.
4:43 p.m.  Court will allow Mr. Johnson to be called as a witness.  
4:48 p.m.  Direct exam of Mr. Johnson by Attorney Grotelueschen.  
4:50 p.m.  Recross by Attorney Dall'Osto.  
4:52 p.m.  Redirect by Attorney Grotelueschen.
4:53 p.m.  Witness excused.  Evidence is closed.
4:55 p.m.  Court will issue a written decision.  
Court is willing to stay and listen to oral arguments but will also give Attorneys opportunity to submit written arguments.
Both Attorneys are to submit their written closing arguments by February 12th.  
4:56 p.m.  Court in recess.

Called @ 2:00 p.m. Defendant Kyle J Johnson appeared pro se. Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Respondent has waived his right to an attorney. Deputy Richard Lagle from Walworth County Sheriff's Dept. duly sworn and testified on direct examination of Attorney Leusink. Exhibit #S1 marked and identified as Criminal Complaint. Exhibit #S1 offered and received, no objection from respondent. 2:06 p..m. Evidence is closed.  2:06 p.m. State moves for bind over. Respondent does not object. Court finds probable cause and will bind over for trial. Information is filed in court, copy of Information is provided to respondent. Information is read and explained to respondent by Court. Respondent enters Not Guilty Plea, reserves right to jury trial. Respodent does not want to subsitute Judge Reddy. Respodent waives Speedy Trial. Status hearing set for May 7, 2015 @ 1:15 p.m. before Judge Reddy. State provided copy of  Victim Impact Statement to respondent in court.
Recess: 2:14 p.m.
Signed bond filed with the court.
